title: Arts-Based Project Learning to Reduce Stigma Surrounding Prenatal Medication Use

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental knowledge in nursing and basic understanding of medication use
context.additional_context: Learners focus on improving stigma perceptions about prenatal medication use and enhancing empathy through arts-based activities in smartphone-accessible environments. Learning progress is continuously monitored through formative assessments

learning_goals: Learners identify and explain at least three social stigmas associated with prenatal medication use.
Learners enhance their ability to empathetically interpret patients' experiences by utilizing arts-based activities (photography, drawing, narratives, etc.).
Learners can confirm changes in their attitudes toward prenatal substance use through self-assessment and peer feedback based on project outcomes.

resources: Artistic Expression Tools (Simple Drawing App, Photo Capture Functionality)
Online Collaboration Platforms (KakaoTalk, Google Drive, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
